page.title: 03AGRICULTURE
page.content: Dominated by small owner-occupied dairy farms of about 50-100 acres,With a concentration of one animal per acre. Predominantly,herds are either Ayreshire,Fresian,or both.Calves are cross-bred with Charolais breeding bulls for beef and are sold within weeks of birth.Milk yield is approximately 3.5 gallons per head per day and the herds are milked twice every day,being fed on meadow grazing and cereals.The current market price of a milking cow is about 500 pounds.Three months before calving,the cows are segregated from the herd to build up strength,and thus are not milked during this period.New calves receive there mother's milk for up to two weeks,in order to create antibodies against infection.
